alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains; Eddy Plains; Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 04 at 2:34AM MST until March 04 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM CST /9 AM MST/ TO 9 PM CST /8 PM MST/ TODAY FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 15% OR LESS, 20 FT WINDS OF 20 MPH OR MORE, AND HIGH TO EXTREME FIRE DANGER FOR THE SACRAMENTO FOOTHILLS, GUADALUPE AND DELAWARE MOUNTAINS, SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO PLAINS, VAN HORN AND THE HIGHWAY 54 CORRIDOR, AND EASTERN CULBERSON COUNTY... * AFFECTED AREA...Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains, Chaves Plains, Eddy Plains, Guadalupe Mountains Above 7000 Feet, Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains, Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor and Eastern Culberson County. * TIMING...From 10 AM CST /9 AM MST/ to 9 PM CST /8 PM MST/ today. * WINDS...Southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 45 mph in the plains. Southwest 35 to 45 with gusts to 65 mph in the mountains. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 10 percent. * RFTI...6 or critical.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity and warm temperatures will increase potential for fire growth.

area.areaDesc: Chaves County Plains; Eddy Plains; Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains
